title: How to Back Up iPhone Photos

steps.title: Tap settings on your home screen.
steps.content: Tap settings on your home screen. This icon has a grey wheel on it.

steps.title: Tap on your name at the top of the screen.
steps.content: Tap on your name at the top of the screen.

steps.title: Turn the iCloud photos button to the on position .
steps.content: Turn the iCloud photos button to the on position . You should now be able to view your photos from any device with iCloud enabled. [1] X Expert Source Gonzalo Martinez Computer & Phone Repair Specialist Expert Interview. 4 May 2021. To view your saved photos , just open the iCloud app or navigate to iCloud.com in a web browser and login to your account. You'll have to select Photos to view your photos.

steps.title: Launch iTunes from your computer.
steps.content: Launch iTunes from your computer. Double click on the iTunes icon, or search for it using the Spotlight search in the top right corner of your screen.

steps.title: Plug in your iPhone to your computer using a USB cable.
steps.content: Plug in your iPhone to your computer using a USB cable. If prompted, tap on Trust this computer on your phone screen.

steps.title: Click on the small iPhone icon in iTunes.
steps.content: Click on the small iPhone icon in iTunes. This is located at the top of the menu screen.

steps.title: Click on Photos.
steps.content: Click on Photos . You should see this on the menu bar on the left-hand side of the iTunes window. If you've already set up your photos to backup to iCloud, you can view them by opening iCloud and logging into your account. [2] X Research source

steps.title: Select a location to backup your photos to.
steps.content: Select a location to backup your photos to. You can choose to backup your photos to a specific folder, or back them up to your photos app .

steps.title: Select which photos or videos to sync.
steps.content: Select which photos or videos to sync. You can either sync all of your photos and videos, or select certain albums to backup to your computer. [3] X Research source

steps.title: Click on Apply.
steps.content: Click on Apply . While your photos should automatically sync, you can manually begin the process by clicking on Sync .

steps.title: Open the Google Photos app on your iPhone.
steps.content: Open the Google Photos app on your iPhone. The icon has a small colorful pinwheel on it. If you do not have Google Photos app you can download it from the App Store . Google Photos is a great alternative if you don't have access to another Apple device. [4] X Expert Source Gonzalo Martinez Computer & Phone Repair Specialist Expert Interview. 4 May 2021.

steps.title: Login to your Google account if you aren't automatically signed in.
steps.content: Login to your Google account if you aren't automatically signed in.

steps.title: Tap ☰.
steps.content: Tap ☰ . This is located at the top right corner of the screen.

steps.title: Turn Back up & sync on .
steps.content: Turn Back up & sync on . This will backup your photos whenever you are connected to Wifi.
